name: Magnesium Sulfate
indications: Polymorphic ventricular tachycardia associated with a prolonged QTI (> 500 msec) (Torsade's de pointes)
Seizures during the third trimester of pregnancy or in the postpartum patient
side_effects: Bradycardia/conduction disturbance (administer with caution in patients with bradycardia)
pearls: Hypotension, bradycardia, and conduction disturbances may occur if administered too rapidly. Administer with caution in patients with bradycardia
Toxicity is associated with CNS and neuromuscular depression. A decrease in deep tendon reflexes (DTRs) is an early sign of toxicity and may indicate impending respiratory depression
The administration of calcium reverses respiratory depression associated with magnesium toxicity
Repeat doses should be administered cautiously in patients with decreased renal function
[AO3] Magnesium Sulfate should be administered as quickly as possible. May cause hypotension and decreased respiratory drive, but more likely in doses higher than 6 gm
[AR4] Consider Magnesium Sulfate with no improvement and/ or impending respiratory failure. Likely more effective with asthmatic exacerbation and less so with COPD exacerbation
[PR7] Consider Magnesium Sulfate with impending respiratory failure and/ or no improvement
